column4: yup icewm is the way to go, installed ltsp with ice as default wm, at senior school 1550 students they loved icewm, you should have no troubles with your choice of WM,  damn even the 'WM for Window Manager sound terroistic'

hi all, Editors, personally i use vim, but im looking for an decent lightweight editor to help someone traverse from an' OS.nonames mentioned' to Linux.Ubuntu , like nedit, gedit but with a file tree explorer. ? anyone.
no, but it lets you explore and then you double click the file you want to open :P
